comments:
20041102

It is possible to enter an invalid workspace encoding on a Hebrew machine. 
This is particularly bad as you will then be unable to re-open the Editors 
preference page to correct it as you will get a "this page is invalid" message.

STEPS
1) Start Eclipse on a Hebrew machine
2) Set the workbench encoding to something with Hebrew characters
3) Hit OK (should not be possible)
4) Reopen the preference dialog 
5) You will get a message that the page is invalid
6) Select Workbench
7) Close the dialog
8) Reopen it 
9) Select editors - you will never be able to get back to the editors page 
again so you will be stuck with a bogus encoding

Here is the exception

a:688)
